1. Redesigned the Theme Editor (again). You can now switch between square buttons and rounded buttons! 
2. All themes are treated as custom themes now. This essentially just means that changing your accent color will now also affect your custom theme. 
3. The Settings and Advanced Options sections will now be themed according to your Accent Color. The text cursors in most layouts will also now use this color. 
4. The "Functions" section has been redesigned to make evaluating functions more convenient. 
5. While typing on the Home screen, the result of your expression will now be calculated as you type it!
 Note: This behavior can be disabled in settings. 
6. The new input method is now finally out of beta! You can now tap an expression on the home screen to go back and edit it from any point. This also means a cursor will now always be shown on the Home screen. 
7. Switched from double to BigDecimal precision, which should improve the accuracy of calculations involving multiple numbers with many decimal places. 
8. The equals/clear animation is now a bit smoother. 
9. The changelog will now display one more previous version. 
10. Updated Spanish translations. Most of the app is now available in Spanish! 
11. Many bug fixes and performance improvements.

1. Fixed a bug that caused some button text colors to not properly reset after selecting \"Reset to Defaults\" in the Theme Editor. \n2. Added the \"sym\" command to the terminal\'s help text. \n3. Minor bug fixes and performance improvements.

1. Completely redesigned the Theme Editor! Editing themes is now much easier. 
2. Importing themes saved using version 13.0.0 and onward will no longer require you to enter a theme name, nor will these themes occasionally import with automatically-populated incorrect names. 
3. You can now make the color of the button above the delete button different from the delete button's color. 
4. Changed the modulus symbol from "%" to "mod" to avoid confusion. If you would like to change back to the "%" symbol, simply type "sym -mod "%"" in the terminal.
 Note: This button will always input "%" into the current expression when pressed, regardless of its symbol. 
5. You can now choose whether the top bar tab is darkened or not in "Advanced Options." 
6. Removed the "backup" and "restore" commands from the terminal, as they were broken and using the new editor for these functions is much easier anyway. 
7. Made a few slight changes to how themes are interpreted under the hood. As a result, some older themes may need to be updated to support version 13.0.0 and above (simply restore each old theme, edit any incorrect colors, then save the theme again). 
8. Fixed a bug that prevented some button colors from changing when resetting a theme back to default. 
9. A ton of bug fixes for tablets and foldables. 
10. Fixed multiple bugs related to the "Date Calculator" section. 
11. The "debug stack" command will now work even after the application is restarted.
 Note: Crash reports will still be cleared after two restarts. 
12. Many other minor bug fixes and performance improvements.
1. You can now assign shortcuts to any of your saved Custom Constants! Try out the new feature by tapping the three dots on any constant\'s card. \n2. Various bug fixes.
1. Fixed a very rare crash that could occur when changing theme settings under very specific circumstances.
1. Fixed a bug that would cause buttons to display incorrectly in landscape layouts. \n2. Other minor bug fixes.

Currently supported commands:
 • help - prints all available commands
 *Note: You can type "help [command]" to learn more about a particular command.
Example: "help set"
 • set [button code] [color hex] - sets a color in the current theme
 • get [button code] - prints a color in the current theme
 • sym -mod [any text] - sets the text of the "mod" button
 • reset [button code] - resets a color in the current theme to its default value
 • copy [button code] - copies a color in the current theme to the device's clipboard
 • share [theme name] - export a theme
 • mode [theme number] - changes the current base theme
 • delete [theme name] - deletes the selected custom theme
 • recreate - restarts the home layout (mostly used for development testing)
 • themes - lists all backed up themes

- Debug commands - 

 • debug [0/1] - enables or disables debug mode, which displays extra information about the inner workings of the main calculator
 • debug sc [0/1] - enables or disables a shortcut that allows you to quickly access the terminal by long-pressing the 0 key on the home screen
 • debug stack - prints the last recorded crash report
 • debug reason - essentially just a shorter version of "debug stack"
 • debug throw - throws a test exception, mainly just to test the "debug stack" command
 • debug last - prints information regarding the last performed calculation
 • tinydb [data type] [key] [value] - accesses or modifies an entry in the application's shared preferences
 • minWidth - prints the device's current minimum width value
 • textSize [size] - sets the text size of main calculator's output (recommended size: between 20-40, default size: 30)
 • accent [key] - sets the accent color when using a basic theme. "key" corresponds to the order of the color in the theme editor (however, baby blue is 17, and bright yellow is 14, so be sure to skip over each of those when counting)

~Help~ 
Description: prints all available commands 
Usages:
 • help
 • help [command]
 • ?
 • ? [command]


Examples: help, help set, ? backup


If the user simply enters "help" or "?", the terminal will simply list all possible commands that can be entered. However, if the user follows either of these with the name of a command, the terminal will then show more information regarding that command.

~Set~ 
Description: sets a color in the current theme 
Usage: set [button code] [color hex code] 
Examples:
 • set -p #FFFFFF
 • set -kt gui


Button Codes:
 -a sets all colors
 -p sets primary
 -s sets secondary
 -t sets tertiary
 -k sets keypad color
 -m sets main background color
 -f sets delete button color
 -tt sets text color of top bar
 -kt sets text color of number keypad
 -ft sets icon color of delete button


-b[Button Text] sets that button's color
 i.e. -bπ sets the color of the π button
 -b[Button Text]t sets that button's text color
 i.e. -b√t sets the text color of the √ button


**Typing any of these followed by "gui" will open a color picker (i.e. "set -p gui")**

~Get~ 
Description: prints a color in the current theme 
Usage: get [button code] 
Example: get -p


Button Codes:
 -a: all colors
 -p: primary
 -s: secondary
 -t: tertiary
 -k: keypad color
 -m: main background color
 -f: delete button color
 -tt: top bar text color
 -kt: keypad text color
 -ft: delete button icon color

-b[Button Text]: specific button color -b[Button Text]t: specific button text color

~Copy~ 
Description: copies a color in the current theme to the device's clipboard 
Usage: copy [button code] 
Example: copy -p


Button Codes:
 -a: all colors
 -p: primary
 -s: secondary
 -t: tertiary
 -k: keypad color
 -m: main background color
 -f: delete button color
 -tt: top bar text color
 -kt: keypad text color
 -ft: delete button icon color

-b[Button Text]: specific button color -b[Button Text]t: specific button text color

~Share~ 
Description: opens the share-sheet so that you can send a theme to another app 
Usage: share [theme name] 
Example: share myTheme


This command is essentially the same as pressing the share button in the "Backups" section of the Theme Editor. It opens the ShareSheet, and shows all apps that can accept text files. This command is necessary now as themes are no longer stored in a user-accessible directory.

~Sym~ 
Description: changes the text (or "symbol") of the modulus button 
Usages:
 • sym -mod "[any text]"
 • sym [button code] "[any text]"
 
(Note: This command currently only works with the "mod" button)
 
Examples:
 • sym -mod "%"
 • sym -b%t "mod"


This command was implemented after the text of the modulus button was changed from "%" to "mod" to reduce confusion among users who are unfamiliar with the modulus function. Some devices may even let you set this button's text to an emoji, though I wouldn't recommend that as it may cause issues.

~Mode~ 
Description: changes the current base theme 
Usage: mode [theme number] 
Example: mode 2


Typing "mode" followed by a number from 1-5, will change your theme to the corresponding theme. For instance, as "Light" is the second option for "Main Theme" in "Theme Settings", typing "mode 2" will change the current base theme to "Light".

~Delete~ 
Description: deletes the selected custom theme 
Usage: delete [theme name]


This command simply deletes the file associated with the selected theme.

~Reset~ 
Description: resets a color in the current theme to its default value 
Usages:
 • reset all
 • reset buttons
 • reset [Button Code] 
Examples:
 • reset -p
 • reset -bπt


This command resets any button, zone, or group of buttons, to their default values. Before update 10.5.0, this was done by entering "set [Button Code] #reset0". The previous method is still functional, however this new reset command is simpler and more reliable.

~Recreate~ 
Description: restarts the home layout


Essentially, all this command does is refresh the home layout to update colors in a theme, set the text and top bar back to their default positions, etc. It's mostly used to test certain things while developing the app. It isn't really too useful, especially since most commands that would require this functionality, do this anyway. However, in certain scenarios it can help with identifying bugs, or testing new features.

~Themes~ 
Description: lists all backed up themes


This command simply lists all the themes that are currently present in the "TermCalc Themes" directory on this device.


*Note: This command will list themes as filenames, i.e. myTheme.txt. When restoring or backing up these themes, the extension is not meant to be typed with the command. So, for instance, when restoring a theme named "myTheme.txt", you should only type "restore myTheme" and exclude the file extension.
Do you want to apply your changes to the current theme?
Helped me find, and fix, a TON of bugs

Tap any button to change its colors. 

To modify entire groups of buttons, select the "Zones" tab towards the bottom of the screen, then tap the groups you'd like to modify. 

To toggle Light/Dark modes, tap the Moon/Sun icon at the bottom of the screen.

The function bar at the top of the keypad can be scrolled both horizontally, and vertically. It can also be expanded by pressing the small arrow key above it. 

You can long-press "√" after typing any number, to input an n-th root (the root being the number you typed initially). You can also long-press "log" after any number to input a log with that number as the base. Finally, long-pressing any trigonometric function will input its hyperbolic counterpart. 

When on the "History" screen, you can paste any history entry simply by tapping it. 

Feel free to contact me from the "About" page if you have any other questions, bug reports, or suggestions! (:
